intro: Hibbertia laurana, commonly known as the golden wattle, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the Dilleniaceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, woody fruits. It is often found in heathlands and open forests, thriving in well-drained soils. Hibbertia laurana is also the national floral emblem of Australia, symbolizing the country's natural heritage.
